page.title: 11A LOCAL FARM
page.content: My grandad works on a farm near Cranwell village. My gran feeds the calves, and the cows are milked and washed. Grandad uses tractors to fetch hay and straw for the cows and leaves it in the barn. There is a pump house to keep the water going to the cow shed. In the dairy there is a tank where the milk is collected, a lorry comes once a week to fetch the milk. When it is time for milking a hooter sounds, this is about four o'clock in the afternoon. The cows are led into the dairy by someone on a tractor. In a little room near to the dairy there are two boards which contain the number of each cow, and show how much milk is given. When milking is over the cows go down the steps and back to the field.
